Topic.Title: WHY GOLD KEEP GOING DOWN??

Message.Msg: Gold is not a store of value as CNBC talking meat-puppets would want you to think. Gold is a measure of the price of labor and capital/energy. If the price of labor/capital/energy falls, so does gold.

Message.Title: Ready to Explode
Message.Msg: The hottest low float technology stock that's next to explode will be Concurrent (CCUR), a company that is positioned to lead the 2013 multi-screen video infrastructure spending boom in the pay-TV industry. It could soar from $6.75 to double digits very quickly. Ericsson (ERIC) just announced they are paying Microsoft (MSFT) almost $200mm to acquire their Mediaroom multi-screen video software business in order to increase their multi-screen reach by 11mm pay-TV households to 16mm pay-TV households. CCUR's MediaHawk multi-screen software is superior to Mediaroom and CCUR has signed multi-screen video delivery deals with the #1 pay-TV companies in Germany, the UK, and Japan. These major multi-screen clients will give CCUR a multi-screen reach of 14.8 million pay-TV subscribers, larger than Mediaroom's reach, which ERIC is paying MSFT almost $200mm for! CCUR has 8.72mm shares outstanding with $24.6mm in cash and zero debt. CCUR has a very low enterprise value of only $34.26mm, which is just 0.52X its annualized revenues of $66.4mm and only 3X its operating cash flow over the last nine months annualized! CCUR's video business, which has also captured the largest video-on-demand (VOD) market share with a reach of over 50 million households, is currently receiving no value! CCUR spent $15mm to acquire their Media Data Intelligence business, which tracks the viewing behavior of 35 million pay-TV subscribers. CCUR also owns a "real-time" ultra high performance computer technology business with annualized revenues of $27.6mm. It has 4 of the world's 5 largest defense contractors as clients and is probably worth more than $25mm. CCUR's extremely profitable multi-screen/VOD video business with current annualized revenues of $33.8mm is currently being valued at less than zero when the VOD space is growing very rapidly and the multi-screen space is about to boom in 2013! CCUR's EPS has been exploding on a quarter-to-quarter basis!

Topic.Title: Retail Option buyerz are dumber than palestinian suicide bomberz

Message.Msg: gee, In reading sybs posts, he does trade around his position and on major drops, which have happened over time cashes in so your calculation of prices probably isn't adjusted correctly. I understand what sybs says about options but I also see the reality of my results and I'll let that be the guide vs. sybs experience with them. I do agree that the short term you go the worse that they can give you the screwjy. I know you trade mostly from the long side but it looks like you want to stand back again a bit today. I think reality is starting to hit the markets and I would not be surprised if we give back a good part of 2013 gains in this correction. I hope for all of our sakes that it is not worse than that because most of this is fake and we all know the underlying economy stinks. I would not be long this going into earnings. I have seen that this can often act well with lousy earnings but in a bad market that usually doesn't work anymore as I always say: "They'll love it until they hate it." Good luck!

Topic.Title: Bought some calls.

Message.Msg: Sybil: "Dont worry, geegee.... Your lossez on thoze callz are 'limited', remember? You just cant go lower than 0.00." Well, because I'm a disciplined trader, I cut my loss near the close on the final-hour bounce, because apparently the situation with my calls changed. The loss is something I can manage. I can wait for another opportunity tomorrow with all cash. I congratulate you for covering the latest 400 shares you were short. See, you can take a profit here and there if you don't go after an "imminent collapse." Maybe you're learning. One more thing you can learn is how to take a loss early. It's really not that hard, you know.
